name: HelmDeploy
description: Deploy, configure, update a Kubernetes cluster in Azure Container Service by running helm commands
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851275) or [see the Helm documentation](https://helm.sh/docs/)
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: cluster
groups.visibleRule: command != logout && command != package && command != save

groups.name: tls
groups.visibleRule: command != login && command != logout && command != package && command != save

groups.name: advanced
groups.visibleRule: command != login && command != logout && command != package && command != save

inputs.name: connectionType
inputs.label: Connection Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select 'Azure Resource Manager' to connect to an Azure Kubernetes Service by using Azure Service Connection. Select 'Kubernetes Service Connection' to connect to any Kubernetes cluster by using kubeconfig or Service Account

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription, which has your Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureResourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Group.

inputs.name: kubernetesCluster
inputs.label: Kubernetes cluster
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Managed Cluster.

inputs.name: useClusterAdmin
inputs.label: Use cluster admin credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use cluster administrator credentials instead of default cluster user credentials.

inputs.name: kubernetesServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Kubernetes Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Kubernetes service connection.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify K8 namespace to use. Use Tiller namespace can be specified in the advanced section of the task or by passing the --tiller-namespace option as argument.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpointForACR
inputs.label: Azure subscription for Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure subscription, which has your Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureResourceGroupForACR
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Resource Group, which has your Container Registry.

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pushing helm charts.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a helm command.

inputs.name: chartType
inputs.label: Chart Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select how you want to enter chart info. You can either provide name of the chart or folder/file path to the chart.

inputs.name: chartName
inputs.label: Chart Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Chart reference to install, this can be a url or a chart name. For example, if chart name is 'stable/mysql', the task will run 'helm install stable/mysql'.

inputs.name: chartPath
inputs.label: Chart Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the chart to install. This can be a path to a packaged chart or a path to an unpacked chart directory. For example, if './redis' is specified the task will run 'helm install ./redis'.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the exact chart version to install. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed. Set the version on the chart to this semver versionâ€‹
inputs.visibleRule: command == package || command == install || command == upgrade

inputs.name: releaseName
inputs.label: Release Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Release name. If unspecified, it will autogenerate one for you.

inputs.name: overrideValues
inputs.label: Set Values
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas or newlines: key1=val1,key2=val2 or
key1=val1
key2=val2
). The task will construct the helm command by using these set values. For example, helm install --set key1=val1 ./redis.

inputs.name: valueFile
inputs.label: Value File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify values in a YAML file or a URL. For example, specifying myvalues.yaml will result in 'helm install --values=myvals.yaml'.

inputs.name: destination
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify values in a YAML file or a URL.

inputs.name: canaryimage
inputs.label: Use canary image version.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use the canary Tiller image, the latest pre-release version of Tiller.

inputs.name: upgradetiller
inputs.label: Upgrade Tiller
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upgrade if Tiller is already installed.

inputs.name: updatedependency
inputs.label: Update Dependency
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run helm dependency update before installing the chart. Update dependencies from 'requirements.yaml' to dir 'charts/' before packaging

inputs.name: save
inputs.label: Save
inputs.helpMarkDown: Save packaged chart to local chart repository (default true)â€‹

inputs.name: install
inputs.label: Install if release not present.
inputs.helpMarkDown: If a release by this name doesn't already exist, run an installâ€‹.

inputs.name: recreate
inputs.label: Recreate Pods.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Performs pods restart for the resource if applicable.

inputs.name: resetValues
inputs.label: Reset Values.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reset the values to the ones built into the chart.

inputs.name: force
inputs.label: Force
inputs.helpMarkDown: Force resource update through delete/recreate if neededâ€‹

inputs.name: waitForExecution
inputs.label: Wait
inputs.helpMarkDown: Block till command execution completes.
inputs.visibleRule: command == init || command == install || command == upgrade

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Helm command options.

inputs.name: enableTls
inputs.label: Enable TLS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enables using SSL between Helm and Tiller.

inputs.name: caCert
inputs.label: CA certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: CA cert used to issue certificate for tiller and helm client.

inputs.name: certificate
inputs.label: Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify Tiller certificate or Helm client certificate

inputs.name: privatekey
inputs.label: Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify Tiller Key or Helm client key

inputs.name: tillernamespace
inputs.label: Tiller namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify K8 namespace of tiller.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: publishPipelineMetadata
inputs.label: Publish pipeline metadata
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, the task will collect and publish deployment metadata

inputs.name: chartNameForACR
inputs.label: Chart Name For Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Chart name with which the chart will be stored in Azure Container Registry.

inputs.name: chartPathForACR
inputs.label: Chart Path for Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the chart directory.

outputVariables.name: helmExitCode
outputVariables.description: Exit code emitted from the execution of specified Helm command
